Present:The Right Hon. Winston S. Churchill, M.P., Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P.,Secretary of State for DominionAffairs.The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. Oliver Lyttelton,M.P., Minister of Production.The Right Hon. Sir Stafford Cripps,K.C., M.P., Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon. Anthony Eden, M.P.,Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs,The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.The following were also present:The Right Hon. L. S. The War Cabinet, decided on the following programmeBusiness. of business when Parliament reassembled on Tuesday, the(Previous 8th SeptemberReference:W.M. (42) 117thConclusions, , ' . .Minute 3.) 'House of Commons.Tuesday, Motion for an Address of Condolence to The King, and for a8th September, Message to the Duchess of Kent, on the death of "H.R.H. the Duke1942. of Kent.These Motions will be proposed and dealt with together.Supplementary Vote of Credit for War Expenditure Committee Stage.The Prime Minister will make a statement on the war situation, followed by a Debate.Wednesday, The Prime Minister will make a short statement on India, in9th September, reply to a Private Notice Question.1942- It is, however, undesirable that Indian affairs should be debated on this occasion, and the Prime Minister will saythat the Government will be ready for the matter to be debated at a later date. In this statement the PrimeMinister will take an opportunity of disposing of mis-statements current in America in regard to the Lord privy seal's Mission in India.The Debate on the War Situation will be continued.The Deputy Prime Minister will wind up on behalf of theGovernment.Thursday, There will be a Debate on Service Pay, on the Supplementary10th September, Vote of Credit (Report Stage).1942. The Government'^ decisions will be announced early in the debate.Friday, Consolidated Fund Bill (for the Vote of Credit); Secondnth September, Reading and remaining Stages.1942. The Chancellor of the Exchequer will make a statement on financial matters, in which he will include a statement inregard to reciprocal Lease-Lend. The adjournment of theHouse will be moved.Future Sittings. When the House rises on Friday, the 11th September, the adjournment will be until Tuesday, the 29th September. Theintention is that,, when the House reassembles on the29th September, the concluding business of the Session will be disposed of. This should take three or four weeks, and the Housemight then adjourn for, say, two or three weeks, until the openingof the new Session in the middle of November. ...House of Lords.The Secretary of State for the Colonies said that, he proposedto make a short statement on the War Situation in the House ofLords on Tuesday. If the House wished for a Debate on the war situation, this would be arranged later in the week.The War Cabinet-Took note, with approval, of this statement. 2. Reference was made to a personal telegram from theViceroy regarding the forthcoming visits to India of Mr. Willkieand of one or two influential American journalists.The Secretary of State for India was invited to send atelegram to the Viceroy, pointing out to him theimportance not merely of affording reasonable facilities tosuch visitors, but of taking every opportunity of enabling them to obtain a better understanding of the position. Ifthis was done, it might have an important effect on publicopinion in America.Great George Street, S.W. 1,September 2, 1942.
